Name: Build Divide
Description:
Aniplex's first trading card game, released in sync with the TV anime of the same name.
In this game, players construct a deck with 40-50 cards and use it to fight with the opponent. Players use character cards to fight, if a character card give the opponent a directly attack, the opponent will lose one life card, the player who makes the opponent's life card to zero will win the game.

Name: Millennia: Tracks of Time
Description:
Millennia: Tracks of Time is a competitive civilization game for 1-4 players.

The game’s setting spans several millennia, a time span of thousands of years. Players go through eight ages, from the ancient to medieval ages, to the modern age, and finally to the near future, until the player with most fame wins. The game features more than 300 unique cards with more than 200 distinct illustrations showcasing historical inventions, buildings, and wonders. Your goal is to acquire the most advantageous cards to advance different aspects of your civilization, like research, military, population, prosperity, and culture.

Millennia utilizes a mix of drafting, engine building, and set collection mechanisms, all while introducing a unique twist with the concept of obsolescence. As time progresses, acquired technology and building cards will become obsolete, lasting only one to four ages before they must be discarded. This feature allows for the pursuit of various strategies during gameplay and, combined with the vast array of buildings and wonders, variable setup, and rich thematic elements, creates an incredibly replayable experience.

Each age has several phases during which the players:


     draft new technology cards from that specific era
     acquire important buildings and famous wonders
     simultaneously use their technologies and buildings to increase various aspects of their civilization
     compare their military strength with that of their opponents to determine the strongest force


After 8 ages, the player with most victory points is crowned the winner!

Name: Mécréants
Description:
A standard medieval and fantasy miniature fighting game for 2 players.
The goal is to defeat the army of your opponent (by killing all his/her miniatures) using dice rolls and miniatures' stats
You use 1d10, a measuring tape, miniatures, each miniature must be attached to a square base.
Each miniature is costing a number of points based on what it represents, what it is wearing and its weapons.
Both players agree on an army budget.
A game is divided in turn, a turn is divided : 1st player range attack, 2nd player range attack, 1st movement and combat, 2nd movement and combar, combats resolution, 1st player range attack, 2nd player range attack

Name: Mécréants: Extension numéro 1
Description:
This expansion adds:

     rules clarifications
     new obstacles (ditches, frieze horses, trap doors, etc.)
     new environments (quick-sand, volcanoes, etc.)
     new creatures (dragons, hydras and chimeras)

Name: Hack Attack Wooden Edition
Description:
With Hack Attack you will think again and again before placing a tile. A game with various strategies to connect or separate paths.

Depending on the role you get, your mission will be to connect or prevent the connection between the hacker computer and the internet. Will you be able to handle such a simple yet complicated task?

Name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Orie Box
Description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Orie - A deliberate counter-attacker, Orie can boost her attacks with strong defense, then seize the advantage to unleash a relentless assault.

Waldstein - Maximize Power! Waldstein's attacks do huge damage and have gigantic range. Watch out for disruption though!

Merkava - Merkava's unpredictable ranges and movement will disrupt foes' strategies and maximize the advantage of his flexible play style.

Wagner - Wagner utilizes powerful boosts to raise her stats and crush rivals. She intimidates foes to control their tempo and keep them on the back foot.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

Name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Seth Box
Description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Seth - Seth's mobile play style shifts rapidly between safe pokes and aggressive critical hits. Find the perfect moment to strike down your foe!

Enkidu - Break through your Prohibition and unleash true power! Enkidu gets stronger as he lands his critical attack, building into an unstoppable force.

Vatista - Control the battle with enhanced mobility and economy. Vatista compounds advantages until she's ready to unleash a massive strike and obliterate the opponent.

Nanase - Nanase's non-stop rapid fighting style will keep opponent's constantly on the defensive. Utilize mixups and counters to keep foes guessing.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

Name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Londrekia
Description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

Londrekia's aggressive style holds the advantage while building up power for massive payoffs.

Not a complete game. Requires another Exceed Fighter to play.

Name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Yuzuriha Box
Description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Yuzuriha - Set up a flurry of powerful attacks and press your luck to unleash them on opponents with Yuzuriha's unique and unpredictable style.

Carmine - Carmine places traps throughout the arena which rise up and attack along with him!

Byakuya - Byakuya's opportunistic and aggressive play style  keeps the pressure on opponents while setting traps around the area.

Mika - Mika doesn't have full control of her attacks, but her boosts give her the opportunity to adjust and rush down opponents as she fights.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

Name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Gordeau Box
Description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Gordeau - A debilitating fighter who drains the opponent then strikes when they are weak. Gordeau's well rounded attacks offer few openings to foes.

Chaos - Utilize superior tactics by placing your attacks anywhere in the arena to strike! There's nowhere to hide from Chaos's ever-present companion.

Hilda - A dedicated zoner who uses conjurations of shadow to keep her opponents at bay. Wear opponents down, or unleash huge attacks to obliterate them all at once.

Phonon - Raise the tempo with compounding power boosts that extend the range of your attacks! Phonon must choose carefully when to press the attack and when to gather strength.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

Name: Room 25: Hypercube
Description:
You are stuck in a maze like Prison. Escape this horrifying by trying to find Room 25, the rumored exit from this nightmare. But among your fellow inmates, may be Guardians, destined to entertain the sick game going on and end your sentence in the most gruesome way possible. You must escape this Maze.

Room 25 Hypercube is the latest installment of the Room 25 Game Series and will allow you to enter a New Dimension with the HYPERCUBE!

On their turn, players will plan their action to interract and move through the different rooms making up the maze like prison they are in. To win, they will have to escape alive by finding the Room 25 and its key at which point the game ends.

The Hypercube adds a new dimension to the game, now split into 3 levels.

Name: Tap It!
Description:
The electronic buzzer game Tap It! with 4 individual buzzers contains four ways to play.


     Memo: works very similar to the MB game "Simon".
     Tap It: quickly press the buzzer that shows your color
     Switch: like Tap It, but with buzzers that light up at the same time and can change their color abruptly. Note: Tap It and Switch can be played with up to 8 players as the game probvides 8 different colors.
     Pong: a table tennis simulation for 2 players.


—user summary

Name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Hyde vs. Linne
Description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 2 fighters and everything you need to play:

Hyde - Hyde is a mobile, high-power fighter who can telegraph his attacks for huge power bonuses.
Linne - Linne's non-stop rushdown style seamlessly fuses boosts and attacks together to create custom strikes.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

Name: Von Danzig nach Warschau
Description:
German war propaganda game to promote Stricker bicycles: A journey through Poland on the trail of the German army.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 in Danzig and have to reach Warschau at space 40. If a player gets on a red space, he wins a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Each red space represents a city or town which was taken by the "Deutsche Wehrmacht" in September of 1939. The text below the game board notes the dates of German victories and sometimes the number of Polish prisoners of war.

Name: Reveal
Description:
This fun and exciting trivia-style board game will put your knowledge to the test and provide hours of entertainment for the whole family. Reveal is a dynamic and engaging board game with a difference: there are no questions, only answers!

Reveal can be played as individuals or in teams and the object of the game is to guess the hidden movie, TV show and song titles to gain medals and walk the red carpet to be crowned Champion of the Titles.

The answer card is loaded into the Reveal card sleeve and then the card is pulled out to reveal only the first letter of each of the words in the title. The player then has two guesses, or 30 seconds, to correctly name the title and win three medals. An incorrect guess will result in the second letter of each of the title words being revealed but the quicker the title is guessed the more medals that are won! Once a player has scooped 15 medals it is time to head for the winner’s square at the centre of the board via any of the Red Carpet routes. In order to be crowned the ultimate Champion of the Titles a player must solve one final title from a category chosen by an opponent!

Name: Città-Stato: Expansion
Description: The Expansion introduces two new Cities (Gaeta and Noli), 15 new powerful cards, and the fifth player's contents. This allows the players to add variability to their games and to play also in 5 players.

Name: In the Stars
Description:
In the Stars is a 1 to 6 player roll and draw constellation game. In the game, players will create two constellations (three in a solo game). In the turn, the active player will choose a blue die and roll it with the rest of the non-blue dice. Then, the active player chooses three dice to draw and creates a constellation. Other players will choose a type from the rest of the three other dice to draw and create their own constellation.

When a player completes their constellations, the game will end when the last player finishes their final turn. Players score points based on the constellations created, the number of alien visits, and wormholes discovered. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Dead Man's Chess
Description:
In Dead Man's Curse, 2-4 players can battle individually, or as teams, to conquer their opponents. Magic, specialty powers unique to your faction, and the ability to defend against incoming attacks are only a few of the powerful mechanics that augment the classic title into something completely different and exciting; Dead Man's Curse! 30+ unique factions exist in the game so far with more to come!

Players on their turn will roll a D6 to see if they can draw a boost card (attaches to a figure and changes how it moves or plays), Draw an Epic Card (these are powerful game-changing events), or in some cases use their factions ability.  Regardless of what they do they move to the Battlefield phase where they draw a card that will allow them to move up to 2 pieces if not more plus they also can make a normal move with any piece. All figures move just like normal chess figures would but that is the only tie to Chess. Don't fear getting your King into the battle as they are your most powerful fighter and can devastate the foe and losing it doesn't lose you the game.

Throw out any pre-conceptions you know about classic Chess, because new moves, accelerated gameplay, and the ability to defend against incoming attacks on each and every combat sets Dead Man's Chess far apart from its predecessor. Strategy is not enough; Luck is not enough… you will need both to win!

Name: Invocación Fronteras: Leyendas de la Torre
Description:
A group of apprentice summoners enter the old abandoned circular tower in Rotrah... It is said that there they hide secrets that no one should discover, a place where the masters are nothing more than curious children, the brave pure fools, where madness is the mana that is breathed, what will they find? who will come back? who will sing his story?

RPG mode expansion for InvocaciÃ³n Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

     Sucubo (14 - Air): Refill another player's Spells or Supports with random discard cards. For each one you place, you gain Mana.
     Acechador (17 - Fire): Defeat all cards in Summon that have 2 or less Supports.



One player is designated the Keeper for the entire game. The rest of the players must take a player sheet.

The guardian will handle all the Golem's card stacks, he can't swap the place cards but he can choose them. 
The players are allies and fight against the Guardian, that is, either the Guardian or a player wins.

The guardian will tell a story using the cards available to him as a point of inspiration. At each stage of preparation the
Guardian tells the story and uses his cards to hinder all players, but they can resolve it with a roll of the dice.

The game ends after 6 rounds, the DM will judge the final result...

Name: Stonesaga
Description:
Stonesaga is a cooperative, campaign style, survival crafting board game set in a unique, persistent world shaped by your choices. It is designed by Max Brooke (Star Wars: X-Wing 2nd Edition, Legend of the Five Rings RPG) with Luke Eddy (Star Wars: Legion).

Generational Storytelling
In Stonesaga, you unfold the epoch-spanning story of the people of a remote glacial valley, guiding multiple generations of characters who make a life there amidst harsh conditions, wondrous mysteries, and giant monsters.

Each game session covers one generation of people within a society, continuing from the last and permanently changing the valley in various ways based on in-game events and the players’ decisions.

Cooperative Survival
Stonesaga follows a certain rhythm: faced by a new opportunity or crisis, the people of the valley must meet their society’s new needs. Meanwhile, the valley’s other inhabitants – immortal beasts – will seek to fulfill their own needs as their instincts dictate. You will have to navigate both sets of challenges, using might, dexterity, conviction, and awareness to survive as a tribe in the wild.

Crafting & Building
Stonesaga introduces a completely new discovery based crafting mechanic. Do you think that a sharpened stone and stick could combine to create a spear? Use the crafting action and find out. You will need to discover the properties of various crafting materials as you expand your crafting “recipe” knowledge.

Work together as a community to build your village together. From a simple fire pit and tent to a forge and library, create a civilization that lasts the generations.

Exploration & Discovery
Stonesaga rewards exploration and chooses to let you experience the world in a unique way each play session. Working on the established rules of the world, you will discover unique materials, monsters, and areas of the world that you won’t be directed towards. Stonesaga lets the curious and inquisitive thrive.

Persistence
Designed for drop-in, drop-out play and flexible playgroup availability, Stonesaga can be played by one group from start to finish, played with a rotating cast, or even passed between groups seamlessly. Components are sometimes permanently altered, but never removed or discarded entirely.

Name: Cat Detective
Description:
Cat Detective is a cooperative deduction game for 2 to 5 players.

In the game, players are children who are blamed for a shattered vase. The goal is to find out the cat broke the vase, where is the other half, how, and when, plus the accomplice cat. In their turn, players will collect cards from others to create sets and eliminate possible crime elements. When a number of sets are created, the game ends, and players will write their conclusions on the report.

If the four main crime elements are discovered, players win the game. If fails, they will be grounded for at least two weeks.

The game is paw. Are you ready to solve the meow-stery?

Name: Culann's Hound
Description:
Before chess, there were the ancient Tafl games of the Nordic & Celtic people.  Rooted in the same idea of military strategy, but with a less complicated rule set.

Due to the less than stellar documentation of these games, there's a number of ways to setup the board, and approach your strategy, but the basics are always the same.  Two teams, a king and his guards, and twice as many attackers, on a checkered board, take turns moving their pawns across the board, surrounding one another to remove them from the board.  If the king escapes to the edge of the board, the guards win, if the king is captured, the attackers win.

Name: Remedial Chaos Theory
Description:
Old school game play, with a new school twist.  Roll the die, leave your home 'timeline portal' and work your way around the board collecting tokens from each of the others.  When you get them all, take them to the 'prime timeline portal' and win the game.

Sounds easy right?  Well, with a non-linear board, figuring out your best move with each roll gets a bit more complicated.  And once you're in a portal, you need the luck of the die to get back out.

Still too easy?  Play it as the 'darkest timeline' and any other players can steal your tokens at any time, sending you back home to start over.  Fun thing is, you can do the same to them.

Name: Murder of a Millionaire
Description:
A murder has been committed in Redmond, a small town just south of London, UK. The body of Chloe Whittle, a millionaire lottery winner, was found late at night in a local park, with a fatal stab wound to the chest. We’ve identified several suspects and assembled this case file of evidence, including photographs, maps, text chains, police reports and more. As the town’s leading detective, we’re relying on you to uncover the truth behind Chloe’s demise.

We need you to analyze and cross-reference the evidence found within the case folder. Your mission is simple: Eliminate as many of the suspects as possible, so that we can find the killer (or killers) and bring them to justice. In addition to the evidence found here, you will also be required to access the internet to uncover further clues to help you solve this puzzling investigation.

29 PIECES OF PHYSICAL EVIDENCE - Inside the case file, you'll find newspaper articles, crime scene investigation photographs, receipts, betting slips, police reports, train times, CCTV footage, phone/text records, a coroners report, a map, witness statements, photographs and more.

SEARCH THROUGH A POLICE INBOX - In addition to the physical evidence supplied inside of the box, you'll need to access an online police officer's inbox to prove the suspects innocent or guilty - but it's not easy...you'll need to be a smart investigator to gain access! 
You will be required to access the internet to view other important evidence linked to the case.

A difficulty rating of 3.5/5 this "whodunnit" style thriller.

Name: Baby Ninjas
Description: Baby Ninjas is a card game of “Hot POOtato.” Players start with a mystery envelope holding either a clean or a dirty baby ninja token. Action cards are used to figure out which baby ninjas are where, move or swap babies around, and make sure someone else who is not you gets stuck with diaper doody at the end of the round.

Name: Behind the Five Seals
Description:
The Mysterious Tower of Magic was left without a master. Now the wizards of the Great Five will have to choose a new master.

The Shaman of the North, the Witch of the East, the Sorcerer of the South, the Seer of the West and the Sorcerer of Outland will leave their regalia and books, amulets and artifacts in the main hall of the Tower. They will go to meet the trials, armed only with their talents, will, knowledge, and with the help of faithful familiars - magical animals. Descending into the dungeons of the tower, players find themselves in the very center of the labyrinth. All possible routes diverge from it, and the most distant rooms contain spell scrolls, only all passages are protected by magical seals of the four elements.

The search takes place in rounds, at the beginning of each of which the players, in turn, take three different-colored dice from the general supply and roll them. Sinces the mage can easily move from one point of the dungeons to another, if there is no obstacle in his way, it is very important not to give rivals a chance to steal the scroll from under your nose. To do this, you need to skillfully occupy strategically important passages with the chips of your mage and familiar. The collected scrolls not only bring victory points, but also allow you to manipulate dice, seal tokens lying on the playing field, and even the enemy.

The game end when a rounds ends with the number of scrolls with a strength of 6 is checked (at least 3 for 2-3 players or at least 4 for 4-5 players).

The winner is the player with the most victory points (the sum of all his scrolls and bonus points for spells).

There was room for five circles of magic in the box, and only two of them (one basic and one additional set of scrolls) are used in each batch. Each circle of magic has its own specialization, so their choice affects the nature of what is happening in the dungeons of the tower. This allows you to diversify the game and provides high replayability.

Name: The Game of Jack and the Beanstalk
Description:
A dual race game.  the giant must race up a staircase, reaching step 40, before Jack reaches the bottom leaf of the beanstalk (#20).

Each player moves by rolling dice.  Jack rolls one die.  The giant, being bigger, rolls 2 dice.

Rules pasted on inside of box cover.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Jack and the Beanstalk

Name: Raindrops
Description:
Raindrops is a game about having fun in the rain.

Every round, players simultaneously choose and play a card from their randomised starting hands. Each card has a specified number of raindrops to be placed on them. The highest unique number (as well as highest unique yellow number) gets to collect raindrops from cards already played, and the lowest unique number receives one raindrop from the bank.

Play cards wisely as same numbers cancel each other out! From the fifth round onwards, raindrops on previously played cards start to evaporate. The player who has collected the most raindrops after 11 rounds wins.

Players can try having the same starting hand for a more competitive variant.

—description from the designer

Name: Crocodile River
Description:
You find yourself in the middle of a raging river in the jungle with crocodiles everywhere. Luckily there are rocks in the river on which you can step. Use numbered cards to move pawns advancing yours or blocking your opponents.

Can you escape the crocodiles and reach the shore first?

—description from the publisher

Name: Alice in Wordland: Curiouser & Curiouser
Description:
New guests arrive at the tea party bringing even more joy and chaos.
Players need to follow even madder rules and things are getting curiouser and curiouser!

Curiouser & Curiouser expansion introduces 4 new characters (the King of Hearts, the March Hare, the Duchess and the Jabberwock) and a new Event mechanic with quirky happenings every round affecting scoring and the character abilities. A mini game might even be added!

Every round, players change their character and a new Event is drawn, changing either the rules or the scoring of the round. Then, according to the rules of the base game, three Forbidden Letters and a Discussion theme are drawn. The player to the left of the Queen of Hearts presses the teapot to start the timer and the game begins. 
Each player has to say a word, suitable to the Discussion theme while avoiding the Forbidden Letters before the time runs out. If they successfully do so, they reset the timer and the next player has to give their own word. If someone doesn't say a suitable word in time they are out for the round and when only one player remains the round ends. The longer each player stays in a round, the more points they are awarded.

—description from the designer

Name: UNLOCK: The guessing game
Description:
In UNLOCK, 1 to 6 players compete to unlock the hidden smartphone-unlocking code created by another player called ‘The Lock’ by a series of attempts. The lock player will give players information about how close they are to the hidden code on each attempt. When at least one of the players finds the secret code, the one that did best in the unlocking attempts will win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Syncron
Description:
Syncron is a quick card game for 4 to 10 players. In Syncron, all players play their cards simultaneously, aiming to move their meeples forward in order to win the race. But in Syncron, a wide variety of skills can be used to win the game, apart from just intelligence. You’ll need empathy, intuition, prescience, negotiation skills and even mind-reading powers.

—description from the designer

Name: LOQ
Description:
Welcome to LOQ, the game of deft descriptions and express guesswork!

On your turn, you draw a card and try to describe as many words and phrases as possible before your time runs out; your teammates try to guess the words. The team scores points for each word guessed correctly. There’s a twist, though: in each round, you have to describe or guess the words in a particular way. For example, sometimes the describer can use just 3 words; sometimes their teammates can make just 1 guess!  Each of the 10 rounds presents a fresh challenge.

There are 5 categories of word to describe: people and places, adjectives(descriptions), nouns (things and ideas)      ,verbs(actions), and phrases. The words can be described in any order. However, in each round there is a key word worth 1 extra point, so it’s often best to start with this.

You can play LOQ in 2 ways:
Cooperatively; with everyone together against the game, or 
Competitively; with teams of two or more players competing against each other.  It’s a lot of fun either way!

The game ends after 10 rounds and lasts about 10 minutes per team. In competitive games, the team with most points wins. If you are playing a cooperative game, check your score against the ratings card for the difficulty level you played at. Was your performance Excellent or just Ordinary?

DIFFICULTY LEVELS
There are a staggering 6000 words and phrases to describe and guess! These are divided into four levels of difficulty: 
Level 1 (yellow) 
Level 2 (green)
Level 3 (red)
Level 4 (blue)

Name: Clash of Armies: Medieval – Hitos
Description:
8-card Milestones expansion for Clash of Armies: Medieval.


We have terrains to fight, we have weather that condition our battles. And now we have milestones. With Hitos, at the moment of achieving these milestones, you will have a benefit that will last you the rest of the battle.

Name: Típico de Machirulo!
Description:
A game to identify scenes of micromachismo. Whoever identifies them the fastest wins!

Típico de Machirulo! is a speed game where players have to find combinations of cards to win. In these cards are hidden figures that represent different scenes of micromachismo in our daily lives.

It also comes with an ideal pedagogical proposal to work on the subject in schools.

Name: Guardians: Dagger Isle (Western Expansion)
Description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG): 123 new cards.
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game. 
Also adds the Freebooter's Stronghold with 3 upgrades cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Grahzue and P'Tal.

Name: Cabbage Patch Kids: Touching Tunes
Description:
Everybody knows the Cabbage Patch Kids! Ever since they were discovered by a little boy named Xavier, they've been making friends wherever they go. Touching Tunes unique electronic game board is filled with musical fun--all at the touch of a finger.

There are 6 fun-filled Cabbage Patch Kids games in all. Some specially designed for the younger player, others for the more advanced. And each one invites players to use elementary skills such as counting, matching, and memory.

1. Side-By-Side - In this game, it takes two cards to make a Cabbage Patch Kid complete. Match the most cards side-by-side and you're the winner!

2. Look Alikes - Here, there are lots of Cabbage Patch Kids! Be the player to match the most cards by the number of 'Kids or the colours of their outfits.

3. Family Five - You'll have an entire family when you collect all 5 Cabbage Patch Kids--each one with a different hair colour.

4. Make-A-Face Race - Be the first player to win all the right cards that make a friendly Cabbage Patch Kids' face complete and you're the winner.

5. The More, The Merrier - In this game, just like in the Cabbage Patch, 'Kids are growing from cabbages. Be the player to "pick" the most 'Kids from the Patch and you're the winner.

6. Heads Up! - Blonde hair, brown hair, black hair, red hair - even no hair at all! They're all here. And it's up to you to win the most pairs of Cabbage Patch Kids by matching their hair colours.

Name: Warp's Edge: Anomaly
Description:
Far from home. Deep in hostile territory. Your starfighter’s overclocked warp drive is now creating anomalies, little tears in the fabric of spacetime that alter situations and require you to adapt on the fly. Can you use these anomalies to your advantage? Trust your instincts. The citizens of the Outer Rim are counting on you.

ANOMALY is an expansion for WARP’S EDGE, a solo bag-building game of space combat. New starfighters, motherships, and skills add to the options alongside the anomalies, an all-new token type.

FIGHT. WARP. REPEAT.
—description from the publisher

2 new Motherships, 9 new enemy ship cards, 2 new player ships, 6 new skill cards
New ways to modify difficulty for all motherships through the Challenge deck.
New mechanic: Anomalies - New tokens you draw from a different bag, providing drawbacks one turn, then benefits the next.

Name: Mind MGMT: Secret Missions
Description:
Throughout the components of the MIND MGMT game, there are 9 hidden codes. When you enter these codes into the website FluxSafeHouse.com, they give you a brand new card that you can print out and add to your game. This Secret Mission expansion provides all 9 of the hidden cards, professionally printed.

Each card will come sealed in an envelope so you can choose to either open them all up, or search for the hidden codes yourself. When you find a code and enter it into the website, you will be instructed to open a specific envelope.

Name: Battle of Chefs
Description:
Preparing a recipe has never been so difficult! Gathering ingredients won't be enough, you'll have to be the smartest and trick other players using all kinds of utensils. Everything is fair in this funny battle of chefs!

Each turn, each player will draw the utensil, recipe or ingredient cards that most interest them. They can then complete up to 3 recipes at the same time and annoy other players with the utensil cards.

You will have to complete the recipes with the necessary ingredient cards without being spoiled by other chefs.

The game ends when a player is the first to reach 8 recipe points.

Name: I'm Right, You're Wrong: Game-Breaker Expansion Pack
Description: Game-Breaker is an expansion pack for I'm Right You're Wrong. It contains 6 mind bending cards that transcend reality and literally BREAK the game. Come back from the dead and completely flip things on your opponents.

Name: I'm Right You're Wrong: NSFW
Description:
What if petty arguments were like a card battle game?

Would you be mean or would you be nice?

I’m Right You’re Wrong (NSFW) is an imaginary argument for adults. Your hand is filled with comebacks like “F*** YOU” and “MY BAD”. Battle it out until one player is left standing, and FOREVER CORRECT!

Sometimes nice guys DO finish last. So, will you take the high road and call a TRUCE? Or, will you tell your opponents to STFU?

Here’s the catch… Most cards suck and there’s only so much kindness to go around.

Pick your battles wisely and don’t shoot yourself in the foot.

How To Play:

1. Draw a card at the beginning of each turn.
2. Play one from your hand and follow the rule on the card.
3. Run out of cards or break a rule, you lose.
4. Get caught cheating, you lose.
5. Game ends when one player is left standing.

Creator’s Comments:  
The message of this game is: WORDS HAVE POWER. In a world growing increasingly combative, people matter. Relationships matter. Whether Right or Wrong, let kindness lead the way.

Name: Zoot!
Description:
If you enjoy Scrabble or Wordle .. Zoot! is here to make your word-nerdy dreams come true!

Object : To obtain the highest number of points by combining the 7 cards in your hand into a single word. Re-arrange your cards until they come close to forming a word. Start your turn by drawing either the face-up card or the one at the top of the draw pile. Then discard one of your other cards to end your turn.

The first person to form a word and yell Zoot! wins the round, and adds 10 points to their score. Their opponent then has one more chance to make a 7-letter word. They pick up one additional card from either draw pile and add a wild card to their hand for a total of 9 cards. Game continues until all cards in the deck have been played, usually 4-5 rounds - and the highest final score is the winner.

Name: Moderner Seekrieg: Neues Marine-Schach
Description:
Whole title - "Moderner Seekrieg. Neues Marine-Schach" (eng. "Modern naval warfare. New naval chess") is a board game, like chess for 2 players (blue vs red).

Each player controls 18 playing pieces - different warships. 
Game play: At the beginning, the game figures are placed in specific squares on the game board (always the same as specified in the instructions). As in the chess, the different figures/ships moves on the game board in different ways and are removed when the square is occupied by another player.

The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Admiral ship (like a king).
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Pax Stellarum
Description:
Pax Stellarum is a spaceship Tabletop Miniature gaming ruleset designed to be able to represent ships from any Sci-Fi universe.

Players are not limited to just designing ships, but can also develop their own fighters, weapons and troops. This allows players to design different forces for each race they play with, thus better representing the diversity found in Sci-Fi universes.

Name: Cthulhu Wars: The Eidolon miniature/card
Description:
Initially part of the Cthulhu Wars: Onslaught 3 Kickstarter, the miniature is also available independently with rules on the publisher website.

How to obtain the Eidolon Loyalty Card: Pay 2 Doom to take this Loyalty Card. Then place the Eidolon anywhere on the Map.

Powers:
Hierarchy (Ongoing): The Eidolon generates 1 Power during the Gather Power Phase. He can be Captured like any Cultist and is Recruited, rather than Summoned. He cannot Create or Control Gates.

Eldritch Wisdom (Ongoing): If the Eidolon is in play, after any player's Action you can force each player to write down his or her next Action and then flip this Loyalty Card face-down. Example: an enemy who plans to Move must write "Move" but he need not say which Units are Moving, nor to where. On each player's next Action, they must perform that Action unless it is now impossible to do so. In this case another Action may be taken. Flip this Loyalty Card faceup in the next Doom Phase.

Name: Factions of Sol
Description:
In Factions of Sol, humanity launched an early space-age in 1927, spearheaded by Mark Megacore, CEO of MegaCore Inc. In the years following, factions grew their power in various regions of the solar system, establishing a tense but stable status quo–until Mark Megacore announced his retirement. Now, the mega-billionaire’s entire fortune is at stake, and everyone in Sol is racing to earn it. You will take command of one of these 8 factions and do your best to bring them to victory. The path you choose is up to you–and could lead to unimaginable riches.

But like all things, accomplishing your mission is easier said than done. To impress Megacore, your ship must travel from planet to planet by spending energy onto the board. But moving into a sector costs energy equal to the amount already in the sector, plus one. Because the energy cost is exponential, the board locks down fast. And your ship can only recharge on one planet: Mercury. So while you may need to travel all the way to Neptune, you also need to make sure you can make it back.

Each player only gets one movement and action per turn. Actions include using Mars to upgrade your ship, obtaining explorers at Venus, picking up secret objectives at Saturn, and more. But many actions cost resources, which can only be mined from asteroids. Each round, a limited amount of asteroids are placed on the board. Getting to them before your competitors is key. When a player can’t take a movement or an action, they must pass. When all players pass, the board is cleared of energy and the race to planets and resources begins again.

At the end of the third round, the game ends and you total up your victory points from machine upgrades, explored exoplanets, secret objectives, and resources. Knowing this, you may want to come up with a plan and stick to it. But just when you think you have your strategy figured out, a number of things might stand in your way– or help you cross the finish line.

Gameplay highights.

-Stellar events: Each round, players can vote between two game-changing options, each of which break the game in a new way. Make sure your favored event is chosen, or you may be left behind when it takes effect.
-Orbiting planets: Throughout the game, the planets will orbit, mimicking the actual movement of planets in our solar system. Players can use them to perform well-planned slingshot maneuvers.
-Faction abilities and machines: Each faction has a special ability and machine that changes the way they interact with the game. When used well, your faction ability and machine can give you a much-needed boost.

Name: Lost for Words: A Game of Untranslatable Feelings
Description:
Lost for Words has over 300 unique words from over 60 different languages, aiming to broaden our vocabularies, as well as our emotional awareness.

There are Word cards and Action cards:
Word cards have a unique word, along with its definition and source language, and one of seven symbols on the top: heart, lightning, cloud, star, sun, moon, or diamond. 
Action cards have special instructions that affect gameplay and strategy.

At the start of each game, each player is dealt seven random cards from the deck, which they keep secret from other players.

On each turn, players have three options:

Play a word card. Place it face-up in front of you, and share how you've experienced that feeling or experience: a moment or memory, who it reminds you of, or how you hope to experience it in the future.
 Play an action card. Follow the rules on the card, which ends your turn. 
 Discard and draw again. Place any of your cards in the discard pile and draw a new card from the deck.

When any player runs out of cards in their hand, draw seven new cards from the deck. The first player to play cards with each of the seven symbols or five of the same symbol is the winner!

Name: Guardians: Drifter's Nexus (Even More Western Expansion)
Description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG). 
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game. 
Also adds the Drifter's Nexus Stronghold with 3 upgrades and 2 downgrade cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Sikura and Vek-Nadra.

Name: Guardians: Necropolis Park (the So Far Western It's Eastern Expansion)
Description:
Expansion for Guardians (FPG). 
Adds new creatures, spells, items, shields and terrains to the game. 
Also adds the Necropolis Park Stronghold with 2 upgrades & 1 downgrade cards and 2 new Vierkuns, Eisnmir and K'Hutek.

Name: Get That Pirate's Booty
Description:
Get That Pirate's Booty is a game of theft, trickery, and sabotage + some pirate ships!

Be the first player to collect 3 sets of 4 treasures or collect all four pirates ships to win.

Battle other pirates for their Booty using challenge cards or use action cards to sabotage other players strategies. Players draw and discard cards to collect sets of cards or steal them from other players using challenge cards.

Name: Spanish Civil War Commander
Description:
"Spanish Civil War Commander" is a deep-strategy educational board-wargame system covering the "Spanish Civil War" in extensive detail. We show the high complexity of running a war through simple and engaging game play. Includes land, sea and air operational units.

Intermediate level multilayered game: military operations, industry, agriculture, foreign relations, bank credit,
Easy to play, hard to master.

Name: Unlimited Brunch
Description:
You and your tablemates arrive at brunch and have "two hours" to eat and drink as much as you want. Unfortunately, sh*t happens. You all must work cooperatively to ensure brunch was worth it for all Brunchers.

Unlimited Brunch is a cooperative card game for 2-8 players, with an available solo mode. Each player selects a unique Bruncher to play as, with each Bruncher having a special ability.

Over the course of "two hours" from "11am - 1pm" or 8 rounds, all Brunchers will order items (food, alcohol, hydration), may share those items with their fellow Brunchers, resolve event cards, and try to avoid vomiting from consuming too much! To win, all players must end the end of round 8 (1pm) in the green ideal zones in both food and alcohol as noted on each Bruncher card.

Name: Kazuni
Description:
Kazuni is a board game that brings all the strategy of building and maintaining supply chains to life in a way that is fun and refreshing.

Players begin by building factories that are used to produce supply crates for a starving city. These crates are delivered as player explore a dynamic, mystery board and purchase the transportation needed to move those crates.

Players are faced with economic challenges while also handling the randomness of an Opportunity Deck that furthers their chains or inhibits their opponents.

Players collect their income for the turn, then take two actions which can be map exploration, supply chain construction, and/or drawing a card from the deck. After performing their actions, any supply crates that currently exist within a player's supply chain will move according to their capacity.  After cargo crates have moved along the supply line, players end their turn by building additional supply crates at any and all factories the player has constructed.

Once a player has successfully delivered 25 crates from their factories to the center tile (City tile) they win the game!

Name: Hastur Rising
Description:
Initially launched on Kickstarter.

A sculpture of Hastur and the King in Yellow as well and rules to use the miniature in Cthulhu Wars, Planet Apocalypse, and Hyperspace.

Name: Moodboard
Description:
The aim of the game is to receive as many like points as possible.

In each round of the game one of the players becomes The Client. The Client gives a brief valid for all the "Agencies" (the other players), and then puts on the table a set of random "Visual Cards" each one showing a picture.

Once the brief is established, each Agency has to propose a creative and effective moodboard, able to capture the fascination (and therefore the likes) of The Client, using some of the Visual Cards taken from the table .

A game lasts as many rounds as there are players (each player plays the role of the client once).

At the end of the game, each player adds up the number of likes received and whoever has the most likes wins the game.

Name: Five Deadly Venoms
Description:
Five Deadly Venoms is a 3-player 18-card game that plays in 15-25 minutes. Each round, one player will face off against the other 2, attempting to earn coins by winning precisely the number of hands that they bid. The first player to win 7 coins, wins the game.

The name and theme come from a classic (1978) martial arts movie by the same name. It featured 5 evenly-matched deadly assassins whose techniques were based on venomous creatures. No one assassin could beat another but by teaming up, two might beat one.

The special features of the game are:

     Every hand pits one player against the other two.
     The deck is comprised of one wild card (the Student), and 17 cards split among 5 suits with a carefully-crafted uneven distribution of card values among the suits.
     Hands are resolved by comparing the two cards played by the lone player against two cards played (one each) by the other two players.


The game is presented as a free print-and-play. The rules reference a bid token, but it is optional. The bid token is a disc with a numeral "3" on one side and a "4" on the other. It indicates who bid and how many hands they bid. The rules also mention 21 tokens/coins. These are used for tracking the score. Use any tokens you prefer or keep track of the score with paper and pencil.

I recommend keeping a copy of the card distribution (the last page of the rulebook) out in front of players. It helps players keep track of the unconventional distribution of the cards among the suits.

I really hope you enjoy the game. It's small and quick, but it has some depth in the play. If you're familiar with Euchre, it's a bit like a 3-player version in which one player always goes alone.

It's a nice filler for when you're waiting for other players to arrive.

Name: Nordpolsflygningen
Description:
Nordpolsflygningen (The North Pole flight).
Typical roll/spin and move board game for 2 players made in Sweden with playing pieces very similar to board games made at the same time in Germany.

Each player starts from different side of the board and should cross separate routes of 45 stops. The first player, who reach 45, wins a game.

Probable date is 1926 based on Amundsen's flight to the North Pole.

Name: Wisdom's Tales: Candy Island
Description:
In Wisdom's Tales, players take the role of one of the Master Wisdom apprentices on a mission to find King's Marshmallow castle and retrieve the Crown.

During the first half of the game, you and your team have to explore the Island by flipping tiles and resolving unpredicted events. Tiles, such as Caramel lake or Bombomb valley, will present some difficulties on your journey and will demand a bit of luck (dice) on your part. Stay close to your team, or wander in another direction, the objective is to locate the Castle and grab the Crown.

The second half starts at the moment a player grabs the crown. Now, you and your team will have to escape the Island, tracing back from your current location to the initial tile. But be aware: You're not only having to go back through all the difficult paths, but Chocolate guards will be on your track to take the Crown!

To successfully finish your mission, all players must get back to the start tile with the crown on one of the player's backpacks.

Will your team be successful on this quest, or will it succumb to those tricky, but weirdly delicious, candies?

Name: Heroclix: Fantastic Four
Description:
In this set, the Fantastic Four are joined by some of their favorite allies such as Wolverine, Ghost Rider and the Silver Surfer to take on some of their greatest nemesis. Dr Doom, Skrulls and the Frightful are just some of their enemies awaiting them on the battlefield. This

Heroclix set contains 16 Common, 16 Uncommon, 16 Rare, 12 Super Rare, 4 Prime and 6 Chase figures for you to collect.

Name: Froschlaune
Description:
Froschlaune is a game collection about feelings, only in German language. Included are 10 games 3 years and up. The cards show 24 frogs ... in different moods.

Included are among games in which you talk, learn and discuss upon feelings: A memogame, 2 moving games, a gesture game, a guessing game.

A fun game collection with cooperative and competitive games.

Name: Maglev Metro: Moonbases & Mars
Description:
Two brand new space-based recessed expansion maps for Maglev Metro that tweak the mechanics and how the game is played, giving the base game even more replayability.

Magnetic Levitation technology is the technology of choice for extra-terrestrial transportation, and your job is to build a network of maglev rails to assist in creating a lunar vacation destination, taking advantage of its 1/6th gravity and relatively flat surface.


     Create your own personal moonbase where passengers arrive from Earth (even if your train is elsewhere)
     Move four times as far (up to 16 stations when the action is maxed out) for no extra cost
     Create a dual-color station in the middle of the map that can accept two different passenger types
     Use new Brake and Reverse technology to make speeding around the map faster and more efficient
     Build track to connect to your opponents' moonbases in order to pick up their passengers.


Mars' colonization has begun, and now it's time to connect locations with maglev railways.


     Zip around the planet by building track all the way around it (instantly going from one side of the map to the other)
     Use the new Launch action to send your train up above the atmosphere and deliver passengers to both Phobos and Deimos
     No need for reverse on Mars, as your train moves backwards and forwards
     Canyons are expensive to build on but provide access to critical stations, including the central launch station


—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Shiho Shota
Description:
Having perfected the martial art of Kyudo that allows an archer to fire their bows with uncanny accuracy, Shiho Shota has become a legend in his own time. He even managed to fire an arrow throw the circular centre of a silvermoon that was thrown high in the air while blindfolded! But Shiho Shota is far more than trick-shots and showing off for the crowd; he has dedicated his entire life to mastering the bow, so much so that it is not an instrument in his hands but an extension of his body and fierce fighting spirit. The years have been hard on Shiho Shota, always hunted and on the run from the Dragon usurper, but such is his resolve; he has never let this wear him down. It has only doubled his will to fight now that the Black Eagle has flown home!

If you wish to run a Shiho warband with a ranged element, Shota is the perfect addition. He can reliably shoot anything. While his ordinary Dai Kyu shots are excellent, his ability to ignore LoS (Line of Sight) while shooting pushes him to the next level! However, the cost of an additional reload marker makes this a complex trade-off. His melee ability is average for Shiho Samurai, but he can benefit from an Enhancement Equipment weapon card. His melee ability is good enough to finish off the enemy models he has already damaged with his bow.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Loyal Kyudoka
Description:
Kyudo, the art of archery, has long been the pastime of the Samurai and those that perfect it become known as Kyudoka. It is extremely rare and frowned upon for anyone other than Samurai to take up a bow for whatever reason. However, the Shiho, with little access to black powder, have made the bow a formidable part of their arsenal. Shiho Shota, a master of Kyudo, has been training loyal Shiho Ashigaru to use this weapon to devastating effect. They can fire several volleys and disappear into the underbrush before an enemy force can even sound a call-to-arms. Shiho Hiroto, never one for rules or archaic tradition was ecstatic to learn that he had some of the finest archers in Jwar who were not Samurai but loyal Ashigaru instead. Shiho Hiroto is a champion of the people and not the power that forces them into submission.
They may only be Ashigaru, but they have a pool of three ranged and access to the Lightweight trait, making them some of the best missile troops in Bushido. For 14 Rice, they have outstanding Range - and Strength - and can keep their distance to stay safe. With the Eagle Feather Arrow as a choice, it gives them that chance to let loose that one vital shot that must do damage at all costs.

Blister contains two miniatures, 30mm bases and a full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mouse Maze
Description:
Your application for ZooLabs has been accepted! You are now one of the candidates to work on a revolutionary study that, through labyrinth experiments, will teach mice to help people escape from natural disasters. On your first day at the lab, you are introduced to your new little friend, and together, you will discover new possibilities for rat intelligence.

In Mouse Maze, players represent young scientists working on various experiments, building the best mouse maze to maximize the mouse's path, trying to get through the most cheese and candy (positive points) while avoiding or closing the mousetraps (negative points).

It’s a flip and write game in which the players draw the walls of the maze, but it's the opponent who will trace the path (and of course, he’ll make the worst route possible). In each turn, one card is flipped to determine which kind of walls the players can draw, some of them including more cheese, candies, or new mousetraps.

The game has a campaign with 30 exciting episodes (split into 10 chapters) that can be played by 1 to 4 players. New rules, objectives and game elements are introduced with each episode, giving players new choices and strategies (without destroying any components). For players who do not want to experience the campaign, each episode can also be played independently of the campaign and out of order, as well as increasing the number of possible players.

That's 30 games in one, and you can choose the best one for you!

Name: Soldaten-Leben heißt allzeit lustig sein
Description:
Whole title: "Soldaten-Leben heißt allzeit lustig sein. Ein heiteres Würfel-Spiel für Front und Heimat" ("Soldier's life means always having fun. A cheerful dice game for front and home"). 
Typical roll and move game. The first player, who reach 75 square, wins the game.
This game was produced in World War II-era and was designed for Wehrmacht soldiers. They could play on the front or at home (like the title said).

—user summary

Name: Crimson Ridge
Description:
Crimson Ridge is a strategic two player card game in which heroes battle each other to capture arenas for their faction by spilling the blood of their enemies. Players play cards face down and reveal them simultaneously to resolve battles. The strategy comes from knowing what your opponent has left in their deck and forecasting their next move. Winning a battle captures an arena for your faction and earns you Victory Points. Crimson Ridge captures the strategy, speed and brutality of melee combat duels in a card game that can be played in ten to fifteen minutes.

—description from the designer

Name: Det bästa ur Drakborgen Återväckt
Description:
Publisher blurb:

Det bästa ur DRAKBORGEN ÅTERVÄCKT (vilket är det fullständiga namnet) är en separat expansion till nyutgåvan av Drakborgen. Denna expansion utökar spelet med 50 kort, bland annat en utbyggnad av underjorden. Samtliga nya kort är illustrerade av Anders Jeppsson, Drakborgens originalillustratör.

DRAKBORGEN ÅTERVÄCKT bygger på en inofficiell spelvariant av DRAKBORGEN som också kallades Drakborgen Återväckt och som 2010 släpptes i en uppsättning med 312 nytryckta kort (vilket inkluderar alla originalkort) av Simon Lundström och Erik Zetterberg. Den här expansionen förutsätter grundläggande kunskap om både nyutgåvans grundregler och de medföljande expansionerna, Drakborgen II och Drakborgen III.

De nya korten har instruktioner som förklarar det mesta varje spelare behöver veta, men i det medföljande regelhäftet finns förtydliganden kring situationer som kan uppstå.

Alla originalhjältar från grundspelet och tidigare expansioner fungerar givetvis även med ÅTERVÄCKT. Denna expansion kräver dock att du använder dig av underjordsreglerna för att fungera fullt ut.

Observera att DRAKBORGEN ÅTERVÄCKT INTE går att spela utan grundspelet DRAKBORGEN. Detta är en separat expansion.

En komplett innehållslista inkluderar:


     1 regelhäfte, inklusive alternativ TROLLDOMSBOK och DRYCKESTABELL!
     50 kort, bestående av:
         6 rumskort
         2 dörrkort
         6 kistkort
         3 sökningskort
         4 rumsletningskort
         18 underjordskort
         9 amulettkort
         2 kort med magiska ringar

Name: Aux Armes!
Description:
A set of 9mm Napoleonic miniatures rules published in issue #61 of Panzerfaust magazine.

It was meant for fairly compact battles, with 4-5 figures for a battalion with a 1.5"x0.5" stand, and decent battles playable in a three foot square area.

This was the basis for the later Grand Army rules published in 1975.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Smart10: Musiikki
Description:
The expansion includes 100 new questions and 1000 new answers.
The theme of the questions is music and include subjects such as pop-musicians, bands, songs, albums, genres, countries and decades.
You can switch the question cards with two theme decks or mix these music questions with half of the general question cards.

Name: Krosmaster: Arena – Arpagone Old Promo
Description:
Promotional Figure with a unique card profile for the Krosmaster: Arena game. A greedy Enutrof that can pay extra Kamas to make her spells stronger.

Note that this minor expansion comes with its unique rule set (profile card) for a new character. Arpagone included in the original "Brotherhood of the Forgotten" expansion has a different rule set.

Name: Wallop!
Description:
Crash! Bang! Wallop! In this exciting game of strategy and luck. The leader which is chosing by who looks the strongest will shout WALLOP! the leader gets first dibs on action cards and every round a new leader is passed in clockwise order. Once the round starts all rounds only last for 30 seconds. This game is played simultaneously so there are no turns or turn order.

First all players roll 2 D6 dice then picks 1 of the rolls to keep and draws an action card based on the number shown on the die.
Action cards can be used at any time unless a card says otherwise.
Always leave 1 action card face up of each number out in the playing area.
Action cards help you deal damage block damage heal you and some may even have special effects no other card ability can do.

At the end of a turn all cards you havn't used get discarded. Each player starts with 30 health and 
players keep taking turns until 1 survivor is left alive.

Name: Napoleonic Kalinatactic
Description:
A brief (two pages) set of Napoleonic miniatures rules published in Panzerfaust #56.

Normal units are battalions of 24 figures, split into six stands of four each (for changing formations). No scale or preferred figure size is given, though considering the era 12 or 9mm figures are likely.

The main element of the rules was the use of written movement orders, so that all movement could be done simultaneously.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Dark Hand
Description: Dual Playing cards, allowing for a number of game variations. Rules for various games are available from the Dark Hand website.

Name: Purgatorio
Description:
After leaving Hell, L. enters Purgatory and finds it being consumed by shadows. Using the energy of her soul, she tries to fight off the darkness, but it may just be enough to shine the path and escape. You will take on the role of L. to save her from being consumed...lost...forgotten...

Purgatorio is a beautiful solo game inspired by Dante's journey in the Divine Comedy. In this game, you will manage L.'s soul's energy and try to light the forest up. Her energy is greatly limited, so you must figure out a way to recycle it as much as you need. The darkness will come, and it will reduce her energy to zero, so be quick...but clever.

During a turn, you will use up to two Energy cards and resolve the effect depending on the combination and placement of those cards; these effects are revealing and/or moving through Purgatory tiles, storing and restoring Energy (cards), and dealing with the Shadows (cards). Your objective is to reveal 18 tiles before you lose all your energy or lose 8 tiles to the shadows. The Shadow cards will be cycling in and out of your deck depleting your cards and the tiles.

If you want to help playtest the game, you can find it here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2965489069
And here is a questionary you can fill up: https://forms.gle/5nruRtZSvkMyP5ps5
I'll be updating the game accordingly :)

Name: Mystery Party in the Box: Bajo la Luna Azul
Description:
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of solving a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are essential pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything they tell you, but you can't take victory without trusting someone either...

Italy, 1962. The head of a local mafia family is murdered in his mansion shortly before he is rumored to announce his successor. Next to the corpse, there is only a handcuffed man. The movements of the victim's little brother and wife, as well as those of the men in the family, the fortune teller who works for the house and the prostitute who frequents the mansion intertwine over and over again until weaving a dense tapestry that hides the truth.

Name: Bankrut
Description: Polish version of Monopoly released at the turn of the 70's and 80's. It differs from the original in that you can take profits from your territories while sitting in prison.

Name: Cards Against Marvel
Description: This is a Marvel-themed Cards Against Humanity clone.  Follows the standard Cards Against Humanity rules.

Name: Ork The Casbah
Description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco 18 magazine.

Finally the Ork Pistols concert tonight! In the Casbah, the coolest rock cave of the Desolate Lands, the punk-ork clans are ready to throw themselves under the concert stage in a frenzied Pogo, by dint of jumps, chases and shoves.
Will you be able to make your clan conquer the best places and keep its members as united as possible, according to the motto of “If the kids are united… then we'll never be divided”?
The evening promises to be very, very… eventful!

In this game, the results of the dice are used to make the members of our rocker orc clan reach the best positions. And eventually to displace rival orcs.
There are two sets of dice. One represents the entry queue. The other set, called "the reserve", is used to choose which die to take from the queue and use for our placement. Then rearrange the queue with the die taken from the reserve.
If you don't have 6 pairs of dice of the same color, there are tiles and rules in the magazine for using only 6 dice.

Name: Fino a prova contraria: omicidio color zaffiro
Description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco #21 magazine.

You are late. Damn if you're late! The Judge will not take it well. But it's not your fault, really! Your colleague, Turk, the one following the case, had a kind of nervous breakdown and left the office suddenly. Now you are here running up the courthouse stairs, dodging the crowds and desperately scrolling through the papers of the first hearing. Because there has already been a first hearing but you haven't read all the papers yet ... and you have to face a murder trial!

Fino a Prova Contraria is a new cooperative game system that can also be played solo.
As a lawyer, the game will see you face a sequence of accusations: in each of them the Attorney will try to prove the guilt of your client. The focal point of each intervention will be highlighted in bold: to it, you will have to respond with a Defense among those available to you, or using evidence or testimony that contradicts the statements of the Prosecutor.
As you try to draft a defense, you will discover more and more details that will allow you to investigate the murder that took place.
The title of this first chapter is Omicidio color zaffiro.

Name: Domesday, The Norman Conquest 1066-1106
Description:
King William…reigned over England, and by his capacity so thoroughly surveyed it, that there was not a hide of land in England that he wist not who had it, or what it was worth, and afterwards set it down in his book. The land of the Britons was in his power, and he wrought castles therein…and extorted from his subjects many marks of gold, and many hundred pounds of silver, which he took of his people, for little need, by right and by unright.  Anglo-Saxon Chronicle, 1087 

King Edward the Confessor of England did not prepare well for his death. To avoid trouble, he promised his kingdom to King Magnus Olafsson of Norway (a claim inherited by Harald Hardrada), King Sweyn Estridsson of Denmark, Duke William of Normandy, and Earl Harold Godwinson of Wessex. When Edward died on the fifth day of January 1066, these four powerful warlords raised armies to back their claims by force. William the Conqueror won the crown but had to defend his new kingdom from fresh invasions and rebellious barons. To formalise his control of the kingdom after twenty years of conquest, he ordered a Great Survey in 1085, a record so final and unalterable that it was named Domesday.

Domesday is a card driven game depicting the Norman Conquest of England from 1066 to 1106. The players control Normans, Barons, English, Danes, Norse, Scots, Welsh, and Irish, playing cards to resolve Events or use Marks to activate their units. Players win by earning the most victory points through controlling, contesting, or plundering areas, building cathedrals and towers, and making their leader the King of England.

—description from the designer

Name: Alice Cooper's HorrorBox
Description: This game is in the style of Cards Against Humanity with added Dare cards.

Name: Top Dogs
Description:
Tricks win the treats in this barking good strategy card game Top Dogs from Ridley's Games. Are you the prized pooch that will win the most treats?

You and your fellow hounds have two rounds to win after starting off with nine trick cards for nine chances to win the most treats and be the ultimutt Top Dog.

Each trick and treat card has a points value, and players must choose which trick cards to play to score the most highly prized treats. Can playing fetch win the treat of a good head scratch? Or can a balancing act land some tasty sausages? Sniff out the 'Top Dog' card which will trump all the other tricks! Will you be top dog or sent to the doghouse?

Pawfect for friends and family fun, Top Dogs includes 95 game cards and instructions. Ages 6+. 2 to 5 players. Average 15 minute gameplay. Printed on FSC paper and with vegetable inks.

Fancy some feline fun? Try our other game in the series, Fat Cats!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rome, LLC.: From Heraclius to Manzikert
Description:
Rome, LLC. is a game of the Eastern Byzantine Empire and Western Frankish Empire from the unification of the Frankish Kingdom by King Chlothar II in 613 CE. to the disastrous defeat of Emperor Romanos IV to the Seljuk Turks at Manzikert in 1071 CE, which precipitated the Crusades.
 Heraclius overthrew the Emperor Phocas in 610 CE, but his prolonged war with Persia weakened the Byzantine Empire, which almost collapsed to the might of Islam and the invading Avars, Bulgars, and Slavs. The Empire survived thanks to the Theodosian Walls of Constantinople, the secret of Greek Fire, and capable leaders such as John Kurkuas, John Tzimiskes, and Basil the Bulgar-Killer, who reconquered territory lost to the barbarians.

King Chlothar II united the Frankish Kingdom in 613 CE, but his inept successors were replaced by the warlord Charles Martell, who repelled the Islamic Invasion at Tours in 732 CE. His grandson Charlemagne invaded Germany, Spain, and Italy and in 800 CE was crowned Emperor by Pope Leo III, reviving the Western Roman Empire. Like its predecessor the Frankish Empire slowly fell apart, divided by civil war, and devastated by Norse and Magyar raiders. The last Carolingian ruler died in 987 CE and the empire split into warring kingdoms.

Two players may play Rome, LLC. one controlling the Eastern Byzantine Empire and the other the Western Frankish Empire. The Byzantines have the larger, wealthier, empire, but their enemies are more dangerous. The weaker economy of the Franks makes them more dependent on allies and marcher lords to guard the frontier and must expand their kingdom into an empire. Each plays their own game side-by-side, with their own statesmen and units, co-operating against invading Arabs, Avars, Bulgars, Magyars, Moors, Norse, Rus, Saxons, Seljuks, and Slavs. The game may be played solitaire, with the player either controlling one empire, or both at the same time.

Each empire has its own statesmen who are made emperors, kings, governors, or rebels. They are rated for their military, administration, religion, and intrigue abilities, and each has a special ability. St Boniface reformed the Frankish Church and the evangelist of Germany, so is a Western Statesman with 1 Military ability, 4 Administration ability, 5 Religious ability, 2 Intrigue ability, and the Convert special ability.

The map has provinces grouped into commands with their own governors, who collects taxes, quells insurgents, fights wars, but may assassinate their emperor or rebel and start a civil war. Emperors counters are used to change commands and rules and determine which statesmen of the new dynasty will become emperor, regardless of their abilities (or lack thereof).
Cavalry, Guards, Auxilia, Forts, and Fleets are used to fight wars and garrison provinces, with some provinces held by allies or marcher lords to protect the frontier from barbarians. Enemy leaders and wars move from province to province until defeated, encouraging revolts, and shrink the empires. Fighting a war may result in a triumph, which removes the war, increases prestige, reduces unrest, generates gold, and annexes provinces, but may also lead to a disaster or bloody stalemate.

Victory is determined by winning Prestige, which is earned by imperial administration, annexing provinces, defeating wars, and financing prestige projects. The loss of both Constantinople and Rome to the barbarians results in defeat, but bankruptcy and unrest can also drive an empire to destruction.

Rome, LLC. uses the system from Rome, Inc. (ATO 53). Each turn represents 5-10 years, with 10 turns in each scenario. The five scenarios start in 610 CE, 711 CE, 814 CE, 888 CE, and 973 CE which may be combined into campaign games. Players may continue the scenarios from Rome, Inc. and Rome, IInc. into Rome, LLC. allowing them to play 17 consecutive scenarios covering 1500 years of history.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: El Último Hombre
Description:
"El Último Hombre" is a card and counter Tactical  level board-wargame in which a command of soldiers or partisans work together to face a mission. On their way to the target they must overcome different dangers in the form of soldiers, tanks, etc.

Juego de cartas y fichas en las que un comando de soldados o partisanos trabajan juntos para afrontar una misión. En su camino hacia el objetivo deben superar distintos peligros en forma de soldados, tanques, etc.

Name: Can You Dig It?
Description:
There's never a dill moment in this absolutely radishing game of Can You Dig It? from Ridley's Games!

In this fast-paced card game, gardeners use trowel and error to harvest fruit and veg from the 4 community plots to develop the most impressive feast by the end of the game.

Cultivate sets of the varieties of fruit and veg cards that are thriving in the garden with the ultimate aim to collect the ingredients needed to make as many of the four recipes (salad, sauce, soup, and stew) as you can to win the most points!

But watch out for roaming chickens -- players can play a chicken card to steal a harvested vegetable from a fellow gardener!

Perfect for plant and gardening lovers, this game is suitable for ages 8+, 2 to 4 players, and has an average 20 minute gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dockfighters: The Ale Wars
Description:
A Miniature Aerial Combat Game with Epic Dieselpunk Fighteraircrafts, Airships and airborne launched Dockfighters, set in 1948.
You move your fighteraircrafts on a hex grid in different heights and with different speeds.
Planes can be equipped with various weapons and your pilots will gather experience during each combat.
You play against or together with friends, in single missions or entire campaigns.

—description from the designer

Name: As Long As The Grass Grows
Description:
Your Father has provided a country large enough for all of you, and he advises you to remove to it. There your white brothers will not trouble you; they will have no claim to the land, and you can live upon it, you and all your children, as long as the grass grows or the water runs, in peace and plenty. It will be yours forever.

President Andrew Jackson

AS LONG AS THE GRASS GROWS is a board game that adapts the COIN Series developed by GMT Games to the Conquest of the American West from 1845-1881. Players use Events, Commands and Special Abilities to place and move pieces on the map to achieve victory. The players take the roles of four Factions; the Great Plains Tribal Faction (GP) consisting of the Comanche and their Kiowa allies; and the Dakota, Lakota, Yankton, and Yanktonai Sioux with their Arapaho, Blackfoot, Cheyenne, and Cree allies. The Northwestern Tribal Faction (NW) has the Chinook, Modoc, Nez Perce, Rogues, Umatilla, Yakima of the Pacific Northwest; the Yaqui of Mexico; the Navajo enemies of the Apaches; and the Crow, Flathead, and Pawnee enemies of the Sioux. The Southwestern Tribal Faction (SW) has the Chiricahua, Lipan, Mescalero and Western Apaches, their Mojave and Yuma allies, and the Bannock, Paiute, Shoshone, and Ute Tribes of the Great Basin. The United States Faction (US) includes the federal, state and territorial governments; the US Army; and militia, miners, pioneers, settlers, buffalo hunters, and railroad companies.

Cards are drawn from the deck one at time, with one card in play and the following card face up on top of the deck. Each Event card shows the order in which Eligible Factions may choose to resolve the Event or one of their own Commands, sometimes with one of their Special Abilities. Resolving an Event or Command makes the Faction Ineligible for the next card. President Events interrupt play as the Factions determine victory, collect revenue, pay upkeep, make treaties, and relocate pieces.

—description from the designer

Name: Rainbow Blvd.
Description:
Build rainbows to make the city of Hopewell Springs beautiful while creating 3D masterpieces in Rainbow Blvd! In Rainbow Blvd. players are animal architects, tasked with completing city plans and private contracts with the goal of gaining the most prestige to become the next head architect at the rainbow factory.

Rainbow Blvd. is played over a series of days (rounds).  Each day begins with players acquiring city plan cards that will reward them for building specific rainbow segments and arcs around the city.  However, take on too many city plans, and there is a risk of losing prestige for uncompleted work.

While the rainbow factory pays well, there are always opportunities for private contracts to help.  The 6 local color companies that produce the materials used by the rainbow factory want their hues to be used whenever possible.  Each is willing to offer more prestige to whomever completes their various goals.

The player who manages to collect the most prestige points before spring is the winner and new head architect at the rainbow factory! Rainbow Blvd. utilizes several fun mechanics including action selection, hand management, a time track, set collections, and more, resulting in a wonderfully beautiful experience around any game table!

Name: Angry Birds Don't See Red
Description:
Come up with the right words, find your way through the maze, spot the differences and land the die right to score high! Each task is a fun challenge, but who will win?

During their turn players pick a card from a shared deck. Each card is a mini game using the game components. The winner of each card takes the card as a victory point. Once any player has 5 cards they win the game.

Name: Medieval Encounters
Description: Enter a world where running into another hero more often than not leads to a duel to the death! Play your cards just right in this strategy RPG duel card game where danger lurks around every corner. But be sure to balance your actions while devising your devilish schemes, because outplaying your opponent is crucial: their demise equals your success!

Name: Lasca & Caos
Description:
